author: Mark Gonzales
title: Four rookies in Cubs lineup points to work of scouting, development staffs
text:
One of the proudest moments of Cubs President Theo Epstein's regime occurred in the hour leading up to Monday's first pitch.
Before Game 3 of the National League Division Series, Cubs scouts and player development officials were honored as they walked along the warning track with their names displayed on the right-field message board.
Their work was reflected in the fact the Cubs started four rookies against the Cardinals. Their progress is a source of pride to the entire staff.
"There's such great opportunity in our organization," said Matt Dorey , director of amateur scouting. "We won't hesitate that if you meet levels, you'll keep on getting pushed and getting challenged. And we're not going to stand in your way if you meet every checkpoint of your development to get to the major leagues."
The four Cubs rookies in the lineup Monday combined for six hits, including three home runs and a triple.
Right fielder Jorge Soler , 23, who signed as a free agent out of Cuba before the 2012 season, set a major-league record by reaching base in his first nine career postseason plate appearances. Third baseman Kris Bryant , 23, the Cubs' first-round draft pick in 2013, drove in 99 runs in his first major-league season.
Left fielder Kyle Schwarber , 22, was drafted in the first round in 2014, and shortstop Addison Russell , 21, was acquired from the Athletics organization midway through the 2014 season. Russell played in only 244 minor-league games before reaching the majors April 21. Bryant played 181 games in the minors, Soler 155 and Schwarber 147.
"It's very encouraging for those younger players to see there are opportunities, and we're going to give them every opportunity to play well and move up the ladder," Dorey said.
Extra innings: Manager Joe Maddon said he would have considered starting left-hander Jon Lester in Game 4 only if Jake Arrieta had been available for Game 5. ... Catchers Willson Contreras and Cael Brockmeyer , infielder Jeimer Candelario , outfielder Mark Zagunis and pitchers Pierce Johnson , Corey Black , David Garner and Rob Zastryzny will play for Mesa in the Arizona Fall League, which opens play Tuesday.
